intro: Sphaeralcea moorei, commonly known as Moore's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Sphaeralcea moorei is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
